availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Kindred (Madison County, Ky, schoolteacher, sgt, QM sgt, and QM, 8th KY Vol. Inf. USA)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, teacher and soldier. Kentucky native. Common school teacher in Madison County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a sergeant, quartermaster sergeant, and regimental quartermaster from January 30, 1862, to November 17, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District no. 3, p. 249.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District no. 1, p. 278.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 783.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 223.
